title: news.com.au — Australia’s #1 news site
text: A split between the unions and Labor over a key trade deal has widened. Despite concerns from the ACTU about Australian jobs being put at risk, the Opposition is poised to back the Indonesian Free Trade Agreement when it comes to a vote. ACTU president Michele O'Neil said the agreement increased temporary work visas without first testing whether Australian workers could do the job. She also voiced concerns about provisions which would allow foreign investors to sue the government. But Labor insists it won concessions that would make it harder for legal action to be taken. Image: News Corp Australia
